newsitem.title: RUSSIA: BASKETBALL-UNPAID DYNAMO BEAT SEVILLA IN OVERTIME.
newsitem.headline: BASKETBALL-UNPAID DYNAMO BEAT SEVILLA IN OVERTIME.

text.p: The long-suffering basketball players of Dynamo Moscow, who have not been paid since the summer, got their reward for calling off a strike by beating Sevilla in overtime in a EuroLeague match on Thursday.
Tied 65-65 with the Spaniards at full time in their Group D game in Moscow, Dynamo ran out 79-75 winners after the extra period. Igor Grachev was the home side's top scorer with 24 points.

Sports-loving President Boris Yeltsin stepped in on Wednesday by signing a decree ordering the government to return state assets, including sports facilities, to the Dynamo sports club, a sprawling organisation which, as in Soviet times, is run by and for the police and other security forces.

The basketball team dropped a threat to strike and agreed to play Thursday's game and next week's final Group D tie against Partizan in Belgrade after Russian Basketball Federation officials promised action in getting their wages paid.
The Dynamo players are among millions of Russians, including hundreds of thousands of striking coal miners, who are caught in a web of company and state debts, unpaid wages and tax arrears.

Thursday's victory was only Dynam's second EuroLeague success in nine games and comes too late to avoid finishing in the bottom three in Group D which means a tougher schedule in the second phase starting in January.
